intro: Phlomis × mobullensis, commonly known as the hybrid hybrid mullein, is a perennial herb native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, upright stems and fuzzy, gray-green leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is cultivated in gardens and landscapes across temperate regions.
